Greetings Humans. It has been quite some time
since any of your kind were last in this
place. Or a Kheltari for that matter.
Thanks...how have you survived down here on
your own? This place was sealed by powerful
Yes, he is trapped in a tower, his wounds
against Sargon were great and he was forced
Vyrmagon knew about this place, but he did
not see everything that happened here. I will
share what I know - but first, I encourage you
to look around the archives here. Then we can

parameters: New Description = 1) Reach the heart of the Stronghold\n2)
So... now that you've taken a look, what are
This place...The Wyrmforge... it's where the
Sword of Souls was crafted, isn't it?
A perceptive human? Who'd have thought it?
My name is Vaeraxis. And may I ask who you
I'm Elim, captain of the Altair Kingsguard.
Odan, also of the Altair Kingsguard.
I'm Tali, an alchemist from Willowbend.
Feylora - a warden of the Kheltari.
Well met all of you. Where to begin? Yes Elim,
you are correct that the dreaded Sword of
Souls was forged here. But it was not intended
as the evil weapon which it became. Centuries
before even the Sargon conflict took place,
we dragonkin were at war with a race of
wield terrifying and potent powers. They are
almost impossible to kill. Trapping them
however, proved to be a much more managable
So your people crafted the sword to capture
time. Things that we often did not have in
abundance. The sword was meant to be a means
of taking these preparations in advance,
so that we could win decisive battles by
trapping their forms in the sword. Normally
when you kill a demon, its spirit merely
needs time to recover, before finding its
way back to this plane of existence. With the
They would essentially suffer a "true" death.
They would be contained within the sword for
Trapped, somewhere between Nowhere and Forever.
A fitting place for such terrible creatures.
So what went wrong? The sword is still at
large, and then there is the matter of the
The demons got wind of our plans. Their master,
Malphas, assumed human form and infiltrated
the Wyrmforge. Visitors from other races were
not uncommon here. We had a common cause in
battling the demons together. But we did not
anticipate his infiltration. Malphas took the
sword and wielded it. It had a two-fold effect.
First, he was able to use it to draw us, and
any other living creature into the blade,
capturing their souls. Secondly - of the
many demons we trapped in the blade as a test,
he was able to unleash them from the prison
inside the sword and overwhelm us here at the
I'm not without sympathy for your plight
Vaeraxis, but imprisoning your enemies in an
eternal prison,monstrous as they are, sounds
I have had many centuries to reflect on our
failure. There may indeed be some truth to
what you say, but at the time it was our best
chance for bringing a lasting peace to the
land. Thankfully though, our master of the
forge had built a failsafe into the weapon.
What kind of fail-safe? Something to destroy
Your mind turns to destructive thoughts all
We actually thought about that - but the
likely end result would have been the release
of all the demons from the sword. No, we
It took longer than we'd hoped to activate,
but a spell placed on the weapon weakened
Malphas, and all the demons who he had
released. We were able to subdue him, trapping
But by that time, the damage had been done?
Quite so. He killed almost all of us here at
the Wyrmforge, before going on a rampage
across the land. He enslaved countless victims,
trapping them in the prison that was designed
for him. Myself and a handful of our kin
survived. After much discussion, it was
decided that the sword should be hidden
elsewhere. After all, if Malphas knew about
this place, it stood to reason that other
Demons would also know about it. We sent out
our greatest remaining heroes, four of them.
We charged them with finding a safe place to
store the blade, so that it might never be
That's how Ziyal found the sword in
What about the shards? How are they involved?
They are a curious side effect that we did
not anticipate. Demons are known for devouring
souls. We long assumed that such souls were
lost - but it appears they were merely
dormant. Souls that are victims of the demons
somehow manifest their energy as these shards,
and they appear in the world, ready to lend
Using the power of the shards, and the
failsafe built into the sword, we were able to
overcome Malphas and seal him and his minions
Why did we need the specific shards from the
Solar and Lunar shrines to access the
It was we who built those shrines, to house
them. They were the shards with the greatest
power so far that we had encountered, and
it seemed like a safe way to keep watch over
them. Songbird was the first shard that was
created, and Sentinel was very powerful. It
Why go to the trouble of sealing the Wyrmforge?
What's down here that's so important?
A very special shard. One which took us
centuries to build. This is the only example
we know of, that was not created from the
What's special about this shard with regards
This one can capture the soul of a Demon - and
You wanted to use it on Malphas I take it?
Malphas is the master of all Demons - putting
and end to him, might put an end to all
demons. This shard is too important to fall
How does all of this tie into Sargon? He's
the reason we have came so far. We know that
he's trapped in the sword, but he's somehow
able to escape from it briefly.
Even Malphas has not been able to do this -
except when he senses life nearby and comes
to claim it. I cannot help you with this
mystery - but from what you say, it sounds
as if there are two dangerous enemies at play
here. You have claimed both of the Celestial
shards - you may be the one to help us
Yes - but if you say there are agents of this
Sargon working to free him, we will potentially
need to deal with both him and Malphas.
Where is the shard that was crafted here?
It is in the heart of the Wyrmforge. I will
open the gate for you. Be careful - some of
my brethren were corrupted by demonic
energies, and have gone mad. They may try to
stop you. Be aware - Dragonkin are bound to
the elements of this world. For example, I am
a descendant of green dragons. I am strong
against wind, but weaker against earth. You
will be able to determine my kin's weakness
based on what they may use against you, or the
mark of their scales. You will need to activate
the forge in order to release the lock on its
door. Be swift - there is a sleeping guardian
who rests in the forge. But if you are quick,
you can get in and out again before it rouses.
I am safe here near the archives. Return to
me when you have the shard, and we can plot

parameters.newDescription:
1) Reach the heart of the Stronghold
2) Investigate the Archives thoroughly
3) Speak to the Dragonkin in the Archives
4)Claim the dragon-forged shard from the Wyrmforge.

I don't know what it means.

This looks like an altar of some sort.
Ok, we're back here - what do we do now?
Tend to the wounded, I will cast the spells
needed to activate the portal and get us
I don't want to discuss it now. Please, check
on Elim, i'll tend to Victoria.
I...no, no i'm not. You... your name is Tali,
Yes, do you remember me? We met before at
Sargon...he was controlling me even then.
I did not realise that he would be able to
How was he able to do this? Elim said that he
saw this happen before - but the other man
When...he was in my head..he mentioned that
I shared a bloodline with him. I think...I
think he is somehow able to exert his power
That must be how Sargon is operating from
I...was there - a dreadful place. There are
many souls trapped there. They keep saying it
lies somewhere between Nowhere and Forever.
It's...some sort of eternal prison. We learned
more about it here. It's inside a sword that
was forged here, but the weapon has not been
When he took over my mind...I saw glimpses of
his. I think...I think the sword is still
somewhere in Shadowfell Spire, but his agents
have not yet been able to find it.
We need to go there - even if only to hide the
sword better such that we can control the
You can't...not yet. He has been working for
centuries on this plan...his descendants are
numerous. No doubt he forced many unwilling
women to bear his children. They have been
orchestrating his plans every step of the way.
I'm only one of many unwilling pawns. But
some of them are all to willing to serve him,
no doubt hoping to earn a place of power in
his new world. He has amassed large forces.
When I met with the batallion that attacked
Castle Altair, I saw more of them. They are
legion. You need to gather allies to stand
a chance of breaking through his lines, and
Come on, we need to get back to Castle Altair
....Tali. No. You need to put me down.
What?!? What are you talking about?
Sargon, I can still feel faint echoes of him
whispering in my mind. He will take control
again at a time that suits him. We cannot
afford for him to have such ready access to
us, or the castle again. I've only broken
free from his control because it took such
concentration for him to deal with you all.
He will be back, no doubt.
You're asking me to kill the Queen...
I'm asking you...to show me a mercy. Please
Tali...set me free.  I don't want to be a
...I will do as you ask. Is there anything
you want me to say, or give to Alex?
Please...give him this. Tell him that I love
him, and that i'm sorry I couldn't be stronger.
Look after Elim...he will not take what
Odan...what did happen to him? Please, tell me
what you can. I...I love him.
It's likely that he was taken back to this
soul prison with Sargon. I know that's not
what you want to hear...but he's probably still
alive. Though I don't know how you'd reach him.
Thank you...for giving me some hope.
Gladly. Now...please do as I asked.
Elim seems stable for now Tali. But he's taken
a bad wound across his eye. He might lose it.
I've shaped the portal to take us all the way
back to Castle Altair. Let's get going.
